body.p: A fair die is rolled 12 times. Consider the following four possible outcomes:
Which of the following is the most likely outcome: (i), (ii), (iii), (iv)?

input.choice: (i) because number of die outcomes (1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6) is equal but in a random order.
(ii) because the number of die outcomes (1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6) is equal.
(iii) because the number 6 is just as likely as any other number on a die.
(iv) because you won’t necessarily get the same number of of die outcomes (1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6) with a fair die.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The die is fair, which means that there is an equal chance of getting any outcome (1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6) on a particular roll but does not mean that exactly the same number of possible outcomes will appear regardless of the order. Since each roll is independent of the other rolls, the probability of the each of the three sequences shown is the same, (1/6)12.
